Constructor Detail

GamePlayer

public GamePlayer(java.lang.String nickname,
                  GameState gs,
                  boolean isDeterministic)
Constructs a game player

Parameters:
nickname - Mascot name of team
isDeterministic - true if player is completely deterministic
Method Detail

getMove

public abstract GameMove getMove(GameState state,
                                 java.lang.String lastMv)
Produces the player's move, given the current state of the game. This function must return a value within the time alloted by the game timing parameters.

Parameters:
state - Current state of the game
lastMv - Opponent's last move. "--" if it is game's first move.
Returns:
Player's move

init

public void init()
Initializes the player at the beginning of the tournament. This is called once, before any games are played. This function must return within the time alloted by the game timing parameters. Default behavior is to do nothing.

messageFromOpponent

public void messageFromOpponent(java.lang.String msg)
This is called to register the opponent's message to this player. This is called after getMessageForOpponent

Parameters:
msg - Message sent by opposing player

messageForOpponent

public java.lang.String messageForOpponent(java.lang.String opponent)
This is called to obtain the string this player wants to send to its opponent. This is called before getMessageFromOpponent

Parameters:
opponent - Name of the opponent being played
Returns:
The string to be sent to the opponent

startGame

public void startGame(java.lang.String opponent)
This is called at the start of a new game. This should be relatively fast, as the player must be ready to respond to a move request, which should come shortly thereafter. The side being played (HOME or AWAY) is stored in the side data member. Default behavior is to do nothing.

Parameters:
opponent - Name of the opponent being played

timeOfLastMove

public void timeOfLastMove(double secs)
Called to inform the player how long the last move took. This can be used to calibrate the player's search depth. Default behavior is to do nothing.

Parameters:
secs - Time for the server to receive the last move

endGame

public void endGame(int result)
Called when the game has ended. Default behavior is to do nothing.

Parameters:
result - -1 if loss, 0 if draw, +1 if

done

public void done()
Called at the end of the tournament. Can be used to do housekeeping tasks. Default behavior is to do nothing.

compete

public void compete(java.lang.String[] args)
Used to compete the player in a tournament.

Parameters:
args - command line arguments passed to the GamePlayer

compete

public void compete(java.lang.String[] args,
                    int dumpLevel)
Used to compete the player in a tournament.

Parameters:
args - command line arguments passed to the GamePlayer
dumpLevel - 0, 1, 2 indicating how much info to display to console
